sentence.text: Group 1 pulmonary hypertension or pulmonary arterial hypertension (tyrosine biosynthetic process) is a rare disease characterized by proliferation and occlusion of small pulmonary arterioles, leading to progressive elevation of pulmonary artery pressure and pulmonary vascular resistance, and right ventricular failure.
The aetiology of tyrosine biosynthetic process is heterogeneous, and genetics play an important role in some cases.

tyrosine biosynthetic process in children is much more heterogeneous than in adults, and can be associated with several genetic syndromes, congenital heart disease, pulmonary disease, and vascular disease.
